humanum_full_description_en:
From " date " from " and ." "Shuowen" is based on the original meaning that the sun is colorless, that is, the sun has no light. "Shuowen": "Pu, Japan is colorless. From the day to merge." This usage is not seen in ancient books. Duan Yucai's note: "This meaning is rarely used in ancient books. [...] This word is borrowed as Pu big ear." See " Pu ".

" Pu " is borrowed to express Pu big and vast. Such as "Mozi. Shang Xian Zhong: "The virtue of a saint is as high as the sky and as universal as the earth." "Selected Works. Wang Ziyuan "Ode to the Holy Lord and the Virtuous Minister": "If you are a good person, you will give up the province and contribute to the public; if you use the tools, you will use less force and follow the others." Zhang Xian's note: "Popular and broad."

" Pu " also means comprehensive and universal. "Jade articles. Japanese Ministry: "Pu, everywhere." Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The Seventh Year of Zhaogong" quoted "The Poetry" and said: "Under the whole world, is it possible that the land is king." "Saving the Side": "The rule of the saint king is universal and love, not close and close, and never travel far."

humanum_full_description:
從「日」從「並」。《說文》以為本義是日無色，即太陽沒有光。《說文》：「普，日無色也。从日从並。」古書中不見此用法。段玉裁注：「此義古籍少用。[……]今字借爲溥大字耳。」參見「溥」。

　　「普」被借為表示溥大、廣大。如《墨子．尚賢中》：「聖人之德，若天之高，若地之普。」《文選．王子淵〈聖主得賢臣頌〉》：「所任賢，則趨舍省而功施普；器用利，則用力少而就效眾。」張銑注：「普，廣也。」

　　「普」也表示全面、普遍。《玉篇．日部》：「普，徧也。」如《左傳．昭公七年》引《詩》曰：「普天之下，莫非王土。」《潛夫論．救邊》：「聖王之政，普覆兼愛，不私近密，不忽踈遠。」

[①]［pǔ］
［《廣韻》滂古切，上姥，滂。］

【辰集上】【日字部】　普； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页496第29
【唐韻】滂古切，音浦。【說文】作暜，日無色也。【註】日無光則遠近皆同，故从竝。今隷作普。　又【廣韻】博也，大也，徧也。【易·乾卦】見龍在田，德施普也。　又姓。【姓氏急就篇】普氏，後漢十姓有之。　又【集韻】【韻會】?頗五切，音溥。義同。
